>>245773017
Basically timelines take up energy, and there is limited energy to go around. Alaya controls the pruning within the Fate worldline, and because Alaya is the unconscious will of humanity to control, it will prune any timeline where humanity does not progress or fails to be on the top of the food chain.

The point of progression is that humanity must leave the gods (end of the Age of Gods), and then go through the Age of Man, which is where humanity slowly acquires all knowledge and must suffer a bit, but not too much, and will progress into the next era, the Age of Will. The Five True Magics of the Age of Man exemplify this, as they do something outside human knowledge (read: break laws of thermodynamics, like creating something from nothing). But in the next Age, those magics will be within human knowledge, and be reproduceable by humans.

Other worldlines have different pruning mechanisms, like Tsukihime or the temporary worldline Morgan creates in Fairy Britain, or the Servantverse worldline (which is kind of like a worldline that’s already in the Age of Will).

I disagree that it's even a good idea. Stories about stories are almost always terrible and masturbatory and yours is a clear example of why.
You've also clearly written the story around the twist and so the twist isn't actually meaningful:
>"Oh, really? In a story with two whole characters the 2nd character was the killer?"
Literally anyone who has ever read a murder mystery is going to work out what happened as soon as she's dead.
Lastly, you've got a gimmick of audience elimination which is completely pointless because it has no impact on the story - and if you get to the point where it could credibly be threatened you've already lost your real audience who will just drop the show.

Most importantly of all though, the premise just isn't that interesting. Who's going to want to watch or read about some virgin loser reading a diary in a library? ESPECIALLY if that diary is also of a loser who spent all of HER time in the library. You're 3 layers deep into the story and all of them are fucking boring.
By that point there won't be anyone left to put to sleep in the audience.
